revision.comment: [[WP:Automatic edit summaries|←]]Created page with 'Leut.Colonel '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is the Defence Attaché (DA) from Maldives to India.He has the honor to be cou...'
revision.text:
Leut.Colonel '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is the Defence Attaché (DA) from Maldives to India.He has the honor to be country's first Defence Attaché to any country and assumed his duties in the High Commision of Maldives, New Delhi in March 2005.
==Early Life== Lt. Col. Shamaal was born to a middle class family in the capital of Maldives, Male'.After joining the National Security Service in April 1988, he has attended various training schools both locally and abroad. Lt. Col Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of Lieutenant after graduating from the Pakistan Military Academy with a Bachelors degree in 1994. Since then he has been trained in the United States Army Infantry School at Fort Benning, Georgia, USA in 1996 and 2000.
Before taking over the post of DA in India, he was Staff Officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defence and National Security. He was also the Assistant to the Commanding Officer of the Quick Reaction Force, which was his parent unit and his arm, the Infantry. His previous appointments include Staff Officer to the Chief of Staff, Training Instructor and member of the NSS Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== Lt. Col. Shamaal had a Masters Degree in Defence and Security Analysis at University of Lancaster, in the United Kingdom from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defence and Security Issues. He has also attended various conferences and seminars on Security and Defence Strategy which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Centre for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non Lethal Weapons Seminar at Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003. Lt Col Shamaal is a graduate of Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India and pursued his second Masters Degree (Obtained first class) in Defence and Strategic Studies from the University of Madras in 2003.
==Family== He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara .

Lt Col Shamaal is a graduate of Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India and pursued his second Masters Degree (Obtained first class) in Defence and Strategic Studies from the University of Madras in 2003.

Lt. Col Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of Lieutenant after graduating from the Pakistan Military Academy with a Bachelors degree in 1994. Since then he has been trained in the United States Army Infantry School at Fort Benning, Georgia, USA in 1996 and 2000.
Before taking over the post of DA in India, he was Staff Officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defence and National Security. He was also the Assistant to the Commanding Officer of the Quick Reaction Force, which was his parent unit and his arm, the Infantry. His previous appointments include Staff Officer to the Chief of Staff, Training Instructor and member of the [[MNDF]] Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== Lt. Col. Shamaal had a Masters Degree in Defence and Security Analysis at University of Lancaster, in the United Kingdom from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defence and Security Issues. He has also attended various conferences and seminars on Security and Defence Strategy which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Centre for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non Lethal Weapons Seminar at Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003. Lt Col Shamaal is a graduate of Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India and pursued his second Masters Degree (Obtained first class) in Defence and Strategic Studies from the University of Madras in 2003.
==Family== He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara .
==External links== *[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's bioghraphy in website of Maldivian High Commission in India]
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

{{Onesource|date=March 2008}}{{Notability|date=March 2008}} Leut.Colonel '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is the Defence Attaché (DA) from Maldives to India.He has the honor to be country's first Defence Attaché to any country and assumed his duties in the High Commision of Maldives, New Delhi in March 2005.
==Early life== Lt. Col. Shamaal was born to a middle class family in the capital of Maldives, Male'.After joining the National Security Service in April 1988, he has attended various training schools both locally and abroad. Lt. Col Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of Lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a Bachelors degree in 1994. Since then he has been trained in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA in 1996 and 2000.
Before taking over the post of DA in India, he was Staff Officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defense and National Security. He was also the Assistant to the Commanding Officer of the Quick Reaction Force, which was his parent unit and his arm, the Infantry. His previous appointments include Staff Officer to the Chief of Staff, Training Instructor and member of the [[MNDF]] Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== Lt. Col. Shamaal had a Masters Degree in Defense and Security Analysis at [[University of Lancaster]], in the United Kingdom from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defense and Security Issues. He has also attended various conferences and seminars on Security and Defense Strategy which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Centre for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non Lethal Weapons Seminar at Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003. Lt Col Shamaal is a graduate of Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India and pursued his second Masters Degree (Obtained first class) in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
==Family== He is currently married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara.
==External links== *[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India]
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

Shamaal had a Masters Degree in Defense and Security Analysis at [[University of Lancaster]], in the United Kingdom from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defense and Security Issues.Lt Col Shamaal is a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India and pursued his second Masters Degree (Obtained first class) in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on Security and Defense Strategy which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non Lethal Weapons Seminar at Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003.
==Family== He is currently married to Mrs.Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara.
==References== *[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India]

He was also the Assistant to the Commanding Officer of the [[MNDF|Quick Reaction Force]], which was his parent unit and his arm, the Infantry. His previous appointments include Staff Officer to the Chief of Staff, Training Instructor and member of the [[MNDF]] Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== Brig. General Shamaal obtained a [[Masters Degree]] in [[Defense (military)|Defense]] and [[Security Analysis]] at [[University of Lancaster]], in the [[United Kingdom]] from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defense and Security Issues. Gen.Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, and pursued his second [[Masters Degree]] (Obtained first class) in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[Security]] and [[Defense (military)|Defense]] [[Strategy]] which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non [[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003 and other conferences in [[New Delhi]].
==Family== He is currently married to Mrs.Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara'a.
==References== *[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India]

revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=June 2010}} [[Brigadier General]] '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is the Commander of the MNDF Male' Area. He also currently oversees International Defence Coopertion in the Ministry of Defence and National Security.
Brig.Gen. Shamaal was born to a middle class family in the capital of [[Maldives]], Male'. After joining the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] in April 1988, he has attended various training schools both locally and abroad. Gen. Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of Lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a Bachelors degree. Since then he has been trained twice in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA in 1996 and 2000.
Prior to taking over the Command of MNDF Male Area he was the Principal Director - Military Liaison at the Integrated Headquarters of the MNDF. He had been the Defense Attaché (DA) from Maldives to [[India]]. He has the honour to be country's first Defense Attaché to serve abroad in a Maldivian Mission.
Before taking over the post of DA in India in 2005, he was Staff Officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defense and National Security. He was also the Assistant to the Commanding Officer of the [[MNDF|Quick Reaction Force]], which was his parent unit and his arm, the Infantry. His previous appointments include Staff Officer to the Chief of Staff, Training Instructor and member of the [[MNDF]] Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== Brig. General Shamaal obtained a [[Masters Degree]] in [[Defense (military)|Defense]] and [[Security Analysis]] at [[University of Lancaster]], in the [[United Kingdom]] from 1998 to 1999 and his research focused on International Defense and Security Issues. Gen.Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, and pursued his second [[Masters Degree]] (Obtained first class) in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[Security]] and [[Defense (military)|Defense]] [[Strategy]] which include Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, Non [[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003 and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003 and other conferences in [[New Delhi]].
==Family== He is currently married to Mrs.Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters Fathimath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara'a.
==References== *[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India] {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}}
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1969 births]]

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and serves as Commander of the Malé area.<ref>[http://www.mndf.gov.mv/v1//uploads/op_chart/op_chart.html MNDF Operational Chart <!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He also currently oversees International Defence Cooperation liaison in the Ministry of Defence and National Security.
General Shamaal was born to a middle-class family in the capital of [[Maldives]], Male'. After joining the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] in April 1988, he attended various training schools both locally and abroad. General Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a bachelors degree. Since then he has been posted twice for training in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA, in 1996 and 2000.<ref>[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India <!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Prior to taking over the command of MNDF Male Area he was the Principal Director - Military Liaison at the Integrated Headquarters of the MNDF.<ref>[http://www.mndf.gov.mv/v1/index.php?mact=News,cntnt01,articleid=423&cntnt01returnid=91 English News MNDF website <!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He had been the Defense Attaché (DA) from Maldives to [[India]]. He was the country's first Defense Attaché to serve abroad in a Maldivian mission.
Before taking over the post of DA in India in 2005, he was staff officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defense and National Security. He was also the assistant to the commanding officer of the [[MNDF|Quick Reaction Force]], was his parent unit, where he was in the infantry arm. His previous appointments include staff officer to the chief of staff, training instructor and member of the [[MNDF]] Scholarship Board.
==Trainings and Experiences== General Shamaal obtained a [[Masters Degree]] in [[Defense (military)|Defense]] and [[Security Analysis]] at [[University of Lancaster]] in the [[United Kingdom]] from 1998 to 1999, where his research focused on international defense and security issues. General Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, where he pursued his second [[masters degree]], obtaining a first class result in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]].

After joining the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] in April 1988, he attended various training schools both locally and abroad. General Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a bachelors degree. Since then he has been posted twice for training in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA, in 1996 and 2000.<ref>[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India <!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>

In 2012 March General Shamaal was nominated and inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform.
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3rd November Medal and Centenary Medal.
==Family== He is currently married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen and Aishath Yaraa.

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and has a military service of more than 25 years. He currently serves as the Commandant of the Marine Corps.
General Shamaal was born to a middle-class family in the capital of [[Maldives]], Male'. After joining the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] in April 1988, he attended various training schools both locally and abroad. General Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a bachelors degree. Since then he has been posted twice for training in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA, in 1996 and 2000.<ref>[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India <!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
He had been the Defense Attaché (DA) from Maldives to [[India]]. He was the country's first Defense Attaché to serve abroad in a Maldivian mission. Before taking over the post of DA in India in 2005, he was staff officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defense and National Security. He was also the assistant to the commanding officer of the [[MNDF|Quick Reaction Force]]. His previous appointments include Commander Male' Area, Commander of Training and Doctrine Command and was also overseeing International Defence Cooperation in the Ministry of Defence and National Security.
==Trainings and Experiences== General Shamaal obtained a [[Masters Degree]] in [[Defense (military)|Defense]] and [[Security Analysis]] at [[University of Lancaster]] in the [[United Kingdom]] from 1998 to 1999, where his research focused on international defense and security issues. General Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, where he pursued his second [[masters degree]], obtaining a first class result in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
Recently, on 7th June 2012, General Shamaal graduated from the National Defense University, Washington DC, USA, obtaining his third masters degree, specializing in Strategic Security Studies. He was awarded a distinguished honor graduate of the course and General Shamaal’s thesis was nominated to present as an honor thesis.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]]. In 2012 March General Shamaal was nominated and inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform.
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3rd November Medal and Centenary Medal.
==Family== He is currently married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara.
==References== {{reflist}}

General Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, where he pursued his second [[master's degree]], obtaining a first class result in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
On 7 June 2012, General Shamaal graduated from the National Defense University, Washington DC, USA, obtaining his third master's degree, specializing in Strategic Security Studies. He was awarded a distinguished honor graduate of the course and General Shamaal’s thesis was nominated to present as an honor thesis.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]]. In 2012 March General Shamaal was nominated and inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform.
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
==Family== He is currently married to Fathimath Firasha and has two daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen and Aishath Yara.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shamaal, Abdulla}} [[Category:Maldivian military personnel]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Pakistan Military Academy alumni]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in Pakistan]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United States]]

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) is a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and has a military service of more than 25 years. He currently serves as the Commandant of the Marine Corps.
General Shamaal was born to a middle-class family in the capital of [[Maldives]], Male'. After joining the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] in April 1988, he attended various training schools both locally and abroad. General Shamaal was commissioned to the rank of lieutenant after graduating from the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] with a bachelor's degree. Since then he has been posted twice for training in the [[United States Army Infantry School]] at [[Fort Benning]], Georgia, USA, in 1996 and 2000.<ref>[http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm Shamaal's biography in website of Maldivian High Commission in India <!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928233515/http://www.maldiveshighcom.co.in/maldives/HC/Shamal.htm |date=September 28, 2007 }}</ref>
He had been the Defense Attaché (DA) from Maldives to [[India]]. He was the country's first Defense Attaché to serve abroad in a Maldivian mission. Before taking over the post of DA in India in 2005, he was staff officer, Foreign Training Coordination in the Ministry of Defense and National Security. He was also the assistant to the commanding officer of the [[MNDF|Quick Reaction Force]]. His previous appointments include Commander Male' Area, Commander of Training and Doctrine Command and was also overseeing International Defence Cooperation in the Ministry of Defence and National Security.
==Trainings and Experiences== General Shamaal obtained a [[Master's degree]] in [[Defense (military)|Defense]] and [[Security Analysis]] at [[University of Lancaster]] in the [[United Kingdom]] from 1998 to 1999, where his research focused on international defense and security issues. General Shamaal is also a graduate of Defense Services Staff College, Wellington, India, where he pursued his second [[master's degree]], obtaining a first class result in Defense and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] in 2003.
On 7 June 2012, General Shamaal graduated from the National Defense University, Washington DC, USA, obtaining his third master's degree, specializing in Strategic Security Studies. He was awarded a distinguished honor graduate of the course and General Shamaal’s thesis was nominated to present as an honor thesis.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]]. In 2012 March General Shamaal was nominated and inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform.
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
==Family== He is currently married to Fathimath Firasha and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen, Aishath Yara and Aminath Emma.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shamaal, Abdulla}} [[Category:Maldivian military personnel]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Pakistan Military Academy alumni]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in Pakistan]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United States]]

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) was a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and has a military service of more than 25 years. General has been trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the United States Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Pakistan Military Academy and Defence Services Staff College, India. He also holds 3 Masters Degrees from different universities, University of Lancaster, United Kingdom, National Defence University, Washington DC, USA, and the University of Madras, India. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
'''Academic Qualifications'''
1- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK 2- Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India 3- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), National Defence University, Washington D C , USA ( Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course)
=='''Military Training'''== 1- Gen. Shamaal is a graduate of Pakistan Military Academy where he did his Military Officers Cadet Training from 1992 -1994 ( 2 Years ) 2- He was trained twice at US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia, where he did his Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) 3-Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India, 1 year, (2003) 4-Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA. (2009)
5-Succesfully completed Special Task Force Training and NCO Cadre Training (1991 and 1992)
'''Achievements ''' 1- In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University, Washington DC obtaining Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies, obtaining his 3rd Masters Degree. He had the privilege of graduating as the Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course receiving distinctions in all the electives (GPA 4.0) and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at the University. 2- Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country’s first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008 and had the role to set up the first DA's office in India. 3-Gen. Shamaal was awarded the best allied cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy 4-In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of inducting to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
'''Command,Staff and Instructional Appointments and Professional Experience ''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, Training and Doctrine Command, The Marine Corps, and former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field on the Instructor role. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]].
'''Decorations''' General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
==Family== He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
'''Other Work Highlights'''
In the period, 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating the political elite and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President’s Office of the Maldives. With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, having the aim to align the armed forces to a democratic system , Gen. Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence to draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country’s history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment. BG Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the DPKO, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations. With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he had been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country’s history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment. BG Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the DPKO, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations. With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he had been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) was a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and has a military service of more than 25 years. General has been trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the United States Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Pakistan Military Academy and Defence Services Staff College, India. He also holds 3 Masters Degrees from different universities, University of Lancaster, United Kingdom, National Defence University, Washington DC, USA, and the University of Madras, India. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
'''Academic Qualifications'''
1- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK 2- Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India 3- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), National Defence University, Washington D C , USA ( Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course)
'''Military Training''' 1- Gen. Shamaal is a graduate of Pakistan Military Academy where he did his Military Officers Cadet Training from 1992 -1994 ( 2 Years )
2- He was trained twice at US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia, where he did his Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000)
3-Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India, 1 year, (2003)
4-Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA. (2009)
5-Succesfully completed Special Task Force Training and NCO Cadre Training (1991 and 1992)
'''Achievements ''' 1- In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University, Washington DC obtaining Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies, obtaining his 3rd Masters Degree. '''Command,Staff and Instructional Appointments and Professional Experience ''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, Training and Doctrine Command, The Marine Corps, and former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field on the Instructor role. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.

'''Decorations''' General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
'''Family''' He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.

He has also served in the field on the Instructor role. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]].
'''Decorations'''
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
'''Family'''
He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
'''Other Work Highlights'''
In the period, 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating the political elite and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President’s Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, having the aim to align the armed forces to a democratic system , Gen. Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence to draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country’s history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Gen.Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the DPKO, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he had been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

'''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) was a [[Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and has a military service of more than 25 years. Gen.Shamaal has been trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the United States Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Pakistan Military Academy and Defence Services Staff College, India. He also holds 3 Masters Degrees from different universities, University of Lancaster, United Kingdom, National Defence University, Washington DC, USA, and the University of Madras, India. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
'''Academic Qualifications'''
1- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK
2- Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India
3- Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), National Defence University, Washington D C , USA ( Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course)
'''Military Training'''
1- Gen. Shamaal is a graduate of Pakistan Military Academy where he did his Military Officers Cadet Training from 1992 -1994 (two years)
2- He was trained twice at US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia, where he did his Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000)
3-Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India, one year, (2003)
4-Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA. (2009)
5-Succesfully completed Special Task Force Training and NCO Cadre Training (1991 and 1992)
'''Achievements
''' 1- In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University, Washington DC obtaining Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies, receiving his 3rd Masters Degree. He had the privilege of graduating as the Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course receiving distinctions in all the electives (GPA 4.0) and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at the University.
2- Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country’s first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008 and had the role to set up the first DA's office in India.
3-Gen. Shamaal was awarded the best allied cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy
4-In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of inducting to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
'''Command,Staff and Instructional Appointments and Professional Experience
''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, Training and Doctrine Command, The Marine Corps, and former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field on the Instructor role. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on [[security]] and [[Defense (military)|defense]] [[strategy]], including Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at [[National Defense University]] (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001; Non-[[Lethal Weapons]] Seminar at [[Bangladesh]] Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003; and Asia Public Affairs Symposium in [[Singapore]] in February 2003; as well as other conferences in [[New Delhi]].
'''Decorations'''
General Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
'''Family'''
He is married to Fathimath Firasha and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
'''Other Work Highlights'''
In the period, 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating the political elite and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President’s Office of the Maldives.

4 - Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009)
5 - Completed Special Task Force Training (1991)
6 - Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
'''Achievements
''' 1 - In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third Masters Degree. He had the privilege of graduating as a Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course, receiving distinctions in all the electives, with a GPA of 4.0, and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at NDU.
2 - Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country’s first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India.
3 - Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy.
4 - In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
'''Command, Staff and Instructional Appointments, and Professional Experience
''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.
'''Decorations'''
Gen. Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
'''Family'''
He is married to Fathimath Firasha, and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara Shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
'''Other Work Highlights'''
In the period of 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating political leaders and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President’s Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, with the aim of aligning the armed forces with a democratic system, Gen. Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country’s history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Gen. Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

{{multiple issues| {{unref|date=December 2018}} {{notability|date=December 2018}} {{dead end|date=December 2018}} }} '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc, born 5 July 1969, was a Brigadier General in the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF) and served in the military for more than 25 years. Gen. Shamaal was trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the United States Army Infantry School in Fort Benning, the Pakistan Military Academy and the Defence Services Staff College in India. He holds three Masters Degrees from different universities: the University of Lancaster in United Kingdom, the National Defence University in Washington DC, USA, and from the University of Madras in India. 5 - Completed Special Task Force Training (1991)

Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

{{multiple issues| {{BLP unsourced|date=December 2018}} {{notability|bio|date=December 2018}} }} '''Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc psc (born 5 July 1969) was a [[Brigadier general|Brigadier General]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) and served in the military for more than 25 years. Brigadier General Shamaal has been reinstated and promoted as a Major General and has been appointed as the Chief of Defence Force of the Maldives, effective 11th December 2018. Gen. Shamaal was trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the [[United States Army Infantry School]] in Fort Benning, the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] and the [[Defence Services Staff College]] in India. He holds three Masters Degrees from different universities: the [[University of Lancaster]] in United Kingdom, the [[National Defense University]] in Washington DC, USA, and from the [[University of Madras]] in India. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
== Academic qualifications == 1 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK
2 - Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India
3 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), Distinguished Honor Graduate, National Defense University, Washington DC, USA
== Military training == 1 - Military Officers Cadet Training at the Pakistan Military Academy (1992 -1994)
2 - Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) at the US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia
3 - Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India (2003)
4 - Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009)
5 - Completed Special Task Force Training (1991)
6 - Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
== Achievements == ''' 1 - In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third Masters Degree. He had the privilege of graduating as a Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course, receiving distinctions in all the electives, with a GPA of 4.0, and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at NDU.
2 - Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country’s first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India.
3 - Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy.
4 - In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
== Professional experience == ''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.
== Decorations == Gen. Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
== Family == He is married to Fathimath Firasha, and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara Shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
== Other work highlights == In the period of 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating political leaders and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President’s Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, with the aim of aligning the armed forces with a democratic system, Gen. Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country’s history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Gen. Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
== Academic qualifications == 1 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK
2 - Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India
3 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), Distinguished Honor Graduate, National Defense University, Washington DC, USA
== Military training == 1 - Military Officers Cadet Training at the Pakistan Military Academy (1992 -1994)
2 - Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) at the US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia
3 - Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India (2003)
4 - Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009)
5 - Completed Special Task Force Training (1991)
6 - Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
== Achievements == ''' 1 - In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third master's degree. He had the privilege of graduating as a Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course, receiving distinctions in all the electives, with a GPA of 4.0, and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at NDU.
2 - Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country's first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India.
3 - Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy.
4 - In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
== Professional experience == ''' Gen. Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Gen. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.
== Decorations == Gen. Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
== Family == He is married to Fathimath Firasha, and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara Shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
== Other work highlights == In the period of 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating political leaders and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President's Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, with the aim of aligning the armed forces with a democratic system, Gen. Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country's history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Gen. Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.

{{BLP sources|date=December 2018}}
'''[[Major General]] Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc ndu psc (born 5 July 1969) is the incumbent Chief of Defence Force (CDF) of [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF).<ref>{{cite news |title=President appoints new police and military chiefs |date=12 December 2018 |work=Maldives Independent |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/president-appoints-new-police-and-military-chiefs-143140}}</ref> General Shamaal was appointed to the post of Chief of Defence Force on 11 December 2018 by His Excellency President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]]. Gen. Shamaal was trained in various world renowned military institutions such as the [[United States Army Infantry School]] in Fort Benning, the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] and the [[Defence Services Staff College]] in India. He holds three master's degrees from different universities: the [[University of Lancaster]] in United Kingdom, the [[National Defense University]] in Washington DC, USA, and from the [[University of Madras]] in India. Gen. Shamaal was previously discharged from service in November 2013 but was reinstated on December 2018 following High Court verdict that his discharge was unlawful. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career. The details of his qualifications are as follows:
== Academic qualifications == 1 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), University of Lancaster, UK
2 - Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), University of Madras, India
3 - Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), Distinguished Honor Graduate, National Defense University, Washington DC, USA
== Military training == 1 - Military Officers Cadet Training at the Pakistan Military Academy (1992 -1994)
2 - Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) at the US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia
3 - Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India (2003)
4 - Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009)
5 - Completed Special Task Force Training (1991)
6 - Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)

Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third master's degree. 6 - Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
== Achievements == 1 - In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third master's degree. He had the privilege of graduating as a Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course, receiving distinctions in all the electives, with a GPA of 4.0, and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at NDU. 2 - Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country's first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India. 3 - Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy. 4 - In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
== Professional experience == Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.
== Decorations == Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, 3 November Medal and Centenary Medal.
== Family == He is married to Fathimath Firasha, and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara Shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
== Other work highlights == In the period of 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating political leaders and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President's Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, with the aim of aligning the armed forces with a democratic system, Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country's history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Gen. Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.
==References== {{reflist}}

{{BLP sources|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox military person | name = Major General Abdulla Shamaal | image = Major General Abdulla Shamaal.jpg | image_size = 220px | birth_date = {{b-da|5 July 1969}} | death_date = | birth_place = | death_place = | placeofburial = | caption = | nickname = | allegiance = [[Maldives]] | branch = [[Maldives National Defence Force]] | serviceyears = | rank = [[Major General]] | commands = [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] | unit = | battles = | awards = | laterwork = }} '''[[Major General]] Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc ndu psc (born 5 July 1969) is the incumbent [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] (CDF) of [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF).<ref>{{cite news |title=President appoints new police and military chiefs |date=12 December 2018 |work=Maldives Independent |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/president-appoints-new-police-and-military-chiefs-143140}}</ref> <ref name="The Edition 2021">{{cite web | title=Shamaal appointed as Chief of Defence Force | website=The Edition | date=2021-07-19 | url=https://edition.mv/search/8243 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210719232301/https://edition.mv/search/8243 | archive-date=2021-07-19 | url-status=live | access-date=2021-07-19}}</ref> General Shamaal was appointed to the post of Chief of Defence Force on 11 December 2018 by President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]]. Shamaal was trained in various military institutions such as the [[United States Army Infantry School]] in Fort Benning, the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] and the [[Defence Services Staff College]] in India. Shamaal was previously discharged from service in November 2013 but was reinstated on December 2018 following High Court verdict that his discharge was unlawful. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career.
== Academic qualifications == * Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), [[University of Lancaster]], UK * Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), [[University of Madras]], India * Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), Distinguished Honor Graduate, [[National Defense University]], Washington DC, US
== Military training == * Military Officers Cadet Training at the Pakistan Military Academy (1992 -1994) * Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) at the US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia * Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India (2003) * Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009) * Completed Special Task Force Training (1991) * Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
== Achievements == *In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third master's degree. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country's first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India. *Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy. *In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
== Professional experience == Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.

His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.

{{Short description|Maldives brigadier general (born 1969)}} {{BLP sources|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox military person | name = Major General Abdulla Shamaal | image = Major General Abdulla Shamaal.jpg | image_size = 220px | birth_date = {{birth-date and age|5 July 1969}} | death_date = | birth_place = | death_place = | placeofburial = | caption = | nickname = | allegiance = [[Maldives]] | branch = [[Maldives National Defence Force]] | serviceyears = | rank = [[Major General]] | commands = [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] | unit = | battles = | awards = | laterwork = }} '''[[Lieutenant General]] Abdulla Shamaal''' MA MSc ndu psc (born 5 July 1969) is the incumbent [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] (CDF) of [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF).<ref>{{cite news |title=President appoints new police and military chiefs |date=12 December 2018 |work=Maldives Independent |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/president-appoints-new-police-and-military-chiefs-143140}}</ref><ref name="The Edition 2021">{{cite web | title=Shamaal appointed as Chief of Defence Force | website=The Edition | date=2021-07-19 | url=https://edition.mv/search/8243 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210719232301/https://edition.mv/search/8243 | archive-date=2021-07-19 | url-status=live | access-date=2021-07-19}}</ref> General Shamaal was appointed to the post of Chief of Defence Force on 11 December 2018 by President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]]. Shamaal was trained in various military institutions such as the [[United States Army Infantry School]] in Fort Benning, the [[Pakistan Military Academy]] and the [[Defence Services Staff College]] in India. Shamaal was previously discharged from service in November 2013 but was reinstated in December 2018 following High Court verdict that his discharge was unlawful. He has also held various Senior Command, Staff and Instructional appointments during his career.
== Academic qualifications == * Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Defence and Security Analysis (1999), [[University of Lancaster]], UK * Master of Science Degree (MSc) in Defence and Strategic Studies (2003), [[University of Madras]], India * Master of Arts Degree (MA) in Strategic Security Studies (2012), Distinguished Honor Graduate, [[National Defense University]], Washington DC, US
== Military training == * Military Officers Cadet Training at the Pakistan Military Academy (1992 -1994) * Infantry Officers Basic Training (1996) and Infantry Officers Advance Course (2000) at the US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia * Graduate of Defence Services Staff College, India (2003) * Graduate of Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA (2009) * Completed Special Task Force Training (1991) * Completed NCO Cadre Training (1992)
== Achievements == *In June 2012, Gen. Shamaal graduated from the Counter Terrorism Fellowship post graduate program at the National Defence University (NDU) in Washington DC, obtaining a Master of Arts Degree in Strategic Security Studies - his third master's degree. He had the privilege of graduating as a Distinguished Honor Graduate of the course, receiving distinctions in all the electives, with a GPA of 4.0, and his thesis was nominated as an honor thesis at NDU. *Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of serving as the country's first Military Attaché in a diplomatic mission abroad. He served as a Defence Adviser in the Maldives High Commission in New Delhi from March 2005 to December 2008, and set up the first DA's office in India. *Gen. Shamaal was awarded the Best Allied Cadet at the Pakistan Military Academy, and was the first Maldivian Officer to be trained in Pakistan Military Academy. *In March 2012, Gen. Shamaal had the privilege of being the first Maldivian to be inducted to the United Nations Roster of Senior Experts on Security Sector Reform (SSR).
== Professional experience == Shamaal is an infantry trained officer by trade who had commanded the Male’ Command (MNDF Male’ Area), one of the four operational joint commands of the armed forces, the Training and Doctrine Command, the Marine Corps, and the former Quick Reaction Forces. He has also served in the field in the capacity of an Instructor. Shamaal also worked in the Ministry of Defence, heading the Directorate of International Defence Cooperation.
He has also attended various conferences and seminars on security and defense strategy, including the Near East South Asia (NESA) Center for Strategic Studies Executive Seminar at the National Defense University (NDU) in Washington DC in May 2001, the Non-Lethal Weapons Seminar at the Bangladesh Institute of Peace Support Operation Training (BIPSOT) in September 2003, and the Asia Public Affairs Symposium in Singapore in February 2003, and other conferences in New Delhi.
== Decorations == Shamaal has been decorated with the Distinguished Service Medal, Presidential Medal, Dedicated Service Medal, Defence Force Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, three November Medals and Centenary Medal.
== Family == He is married to Fathimath Firasha, and has three daughters, Fathmath Yasmeen Shamaal, Aishath Yara Shamaal and Aminath Emma Shamaal.
== Other work highlights == In the period of 2009 to 2010, Gen. Shamaal also had the opportunity to take the initiative and play a key role in drafting and educating political leaders and security managers on the National Security Framework envisioned in the Strategic Action Plan of the President's Office of the Maldives.
With the transformation to a multi -party democracy in the Maldives in 2008, with the aim of aligning the armed forces with a democratic system, Shamaal helped the Ministry of Defence draft the new strategic vision for the armed forces - the Strategic Defence Directive (SDD) in May 2009. The aim of the SDD was to conceptualize the national security related policy and the defence structure of the country. It was the first explicit defence policy document written in the country's history which gave policy, strategic and doctrinal guidance to the defence establishment.
Shamaal also has the honor of being a senior member of the team that represented the presentation of the claim on the Maldives continental shelf at the United Nations HQ in New York, in March 2011. Later, he was also a senior member of the defence team that represented Maldives at the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, where they formally indicated the Maldives’ desire to take part in the UN peacekeeping operations in the future. His office in the Defence Ministry initiated and drafted the project for the soldiers to take part in the peacekeeping operations.
With the assistance from the United States government, and other countries, he has been able to host and coordinate several workshops and forums to educate and train the broader security community, practitioners and the political elite in the country on the need to create integration, participation and synergy within security agencies, and facilitate the democratization and nation-building process.
